title: What Are Surfer Curtains? Getting This TikTok Look

steps.title: Surfer curtains are a hairstyle inspired by 90’s heartthrobs.
steps.content: Surfer curtains are a hairstyle inspired by 90’s heartthrobs. This trendy, mainly male, hairstyle consists of tousled curtain bangs and a middle part, with voluminous, beachy texture. Surfer curtains are typically a mid-length haircut but can look great on any hair length or texture. [1] X Research source Though surfer curtains are mostly viewed as a male haircut, anyone can rock this look regardless of gender. Surfer curtains gained popularity after TikTok user James Edward posted about them. 90s-inspired fashion is currently all the rage, and this hairstyle is no exception.

steps.title: Ask your stylist for curtain bangs.
steps.content: Ask your stylist for curtain bangs. In order to achieve surfer curtains, you need to have the right haircut. Bring some inspiration photos to your stylist and work together to determine the best cut for your hair type and face shape. For the standard surfer curtain look, ask for face-framing curtain bangs at the cheekbone. [2] X Research source If you have experience cutting hair, try cutting your own curtain bangs to save money.

steps.title: Start with wet hair.
steps.content: Start with wet hair. It’s typically best to style your surfer curtains right after you wash your hair, as you’ll be adding product to it. Styling surfer curtains can be a little different depending on your hair type. In general, though, your hair should be wet or damp. [3] X Research source If your hair is straight or mostly straight: style your hair before drying it at all. If your hair is curly or wavy: towel dry it so it’s a bit damp before styling.

steps.title: Part your hair and add a styling cream.
steps.content: Part your hair and add a styling cream. Part your hair down the middle so your bangs frame your face correctly, or part it slightly off-center for a more natural look. Choose your preferred styling cream and scrunch it into your hair. Pay special attention to your curtain and push the hair forward at the root, slightly twisting it away from your face. [4] X Research source If your hair needs a little extra volume, now is also the time to add a volumizing spray . This will help finer, straighter hair, and may not be necessary for curly hair. Scrunch the spray into your hair like you did the styling cream.

steps.title: Add a sea salt spray and let your hair dry.
steps.content: Add a sea salt spray and let your hair dry. The sea salt spray will give you that beachy look you’re going for. Simply spray it throughout your hair and scrunch it as it dries. [5] X Research source If you have straight hair: either allow your hair to air dry or use a hair dryer. If you have curly hair: it’s usually best to let your hair air dry. Depending on how curly your hair is, sometimes towel drying it and applying sea salt spray will be enough to get your desired look. Test out different styling methods to see what works best for you.

steps.title: Choose a mid-length cut to boost volume.
steps.content: Choose a mid-length cut to boost volume. Mid-length surfer curtains are popular for a reason; they give you that traditional 90s look while adding volume to your hair. If you have a lot of hair, this cut gives you the body you need to make it shine.

steps.title: Go for long curtains for a more feminine look.
steps.content: Go for long curtains for a more feminine look. This look is great for women or anyone who wants to embrace their feminine side. Add long layers to your hair while still maintaining that curtain bang shape. If your hair naturally has some wave to it, this look will be easy to style. Plus, the longer your hair, the more you look like an actual surfer!

steps.title: Choose short surfer curtains to frame your face.
steps.content: Choose short surfer curtains to frame your face. If you’re also a fan of the wolf cut, shorter surfer curtains may be the style for you. This look is cropped, with a soft fringe that frames your face. Since your hair is mostly the same length, this style is also super easy to grow out. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Flip out your ends for a tousled look.
steps.content: Flip out your ends for a tousled look. If you have straight hair, this is a great way to give your surfer curtains the added texture they need. Flip the ends of your hair out away from your face and tease your roots to get some extra volume. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Get a boyfriend bob for a sleeker style.
steps.content: Get a boyfriend bob for a sleeker style. If you like the 90s heartthrob aesthetic but want something with a little less volume, consider the boyfriend bob. The style resembles surfer curtains but longer and with no layers. While this style can be worn by any gender, it’s mainly been adopted by women. [8] X Research source
